Questions and Answers

Source: vignettes/questions-and-answers.Rmd
questions-and-answers.Rmd

What is fgeo?

fgeo is a kind of umbrella: It is a meta-package that gathers multiple modules of ForestGEO’s software – each module corresponding to an individual package. This modularity facilitates managing and expanding ForestGEO’s software.

How can I learn about fgeo before installing it?

See [Search Packages] and follow the links to online documentation.

How can I start using fgeo?

From R, begin by installing fgeo. Then load it with:

library(fgeo)
#> -- Attaching packages ---------------------------------- fgeo 0.0.0.9000 --
#> v bciex           0.0.0.9000     v fgeo.demography 0.0.0.9000
#> v fgeo.abundance  0.0.0.9004     v fgeo.habitat    0.0.0.9006
#> v fgeo.base       0.0.0.9001     v fgeo.map        0.0.0.9204
#> v fgeo.data       0.0.0.9002     v fgeo.tool       0.0.0.9003
#> -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ fgeo_conflicts() --
#> x fgeo.tool::filter() masks stats::filter()

How can I update fgeo?

fgeo_update()

Does fgeo conflict with my other packages?

fgeo_conflicts()
#> -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ fgeo_conflicts() --
#> x fgeo.tool::filter() masks stats::filter()

See also the conflicted package.

What are the core packages of fgeo?

fgeo_core()
#> [1] "bciex"           "fgeo.abundance"  "fgeo.base"       "fgeo.data"      
#> [5] "fgeo.demography" "fgeo.habitat"    "fgeo.map"        "fgeo.tool"

What are the core packages for?

fgeo_index_packages()
#> Warning: 'DESCRIPTION' file has an 'Encoding' field and re-encoding is not
#> possible
#>           package                                           Title
#> 1           bciex Forest Dynamics Data from Barro Colorado Island
#> 2            fgeo       Easily Install and Load Multiple Packages
#> 3  fgeo.abundance   Calculate Abundance, Basal Area and Diversity
#> 4       fgeo.base ForestGEO Functions With No External Dependency
#> 5       fgeo.data                      Open Datasets of ForestGEO
#> 6 fgeo.demography     Calculate Mortality, Recruitment and Growth
#> 7    fgeo.habitat             Analyze Soils and Tree-Habitat Data
#> 8        fgeo.map               Map Species, Trees and Topography
#> 9       fgeo.tool                  Functions for General Purposes

How can I learn more?

fgeo_help()

How can I contribute to fgeo?

See Information > Contributing

How can I get help about some code?

See Information > Getting help

How can I report a bug?

Open a New issue

How can I browse source code?

Browse all source code at https://github.com/forestgeo/fgeo

How can I find the source code of a specific function?

  1. Browse to the relevant package’s website (e.g. fgeo).

  2. Fin the function under Reference (e.g. fgeo’s Reference).

  3. Click the link to Source under the topic’s title. For example:

Where can I discuss a general question with fgeo’s community?

Open a New issue at forestgeo/forum.

Where can I find or share general resources with fgeo’s community?

Visit forestgeo/learn.

How can I try fgeo before I install it?

Try fgeo on rstudio.cloud for free at http://bit.ly/fgeo-demo. Ensure you have the latest version with:

library(fgeo)
fgeo_update()

How to contact a human?

Contact fgeo’s maintainer.

How can I get up to date with fgeo’s developments?

Checkout fgeo’s blog.

Follow [@mauro_lepore](https://twitter.com/mauro_lepore) or #fgeo #rstats on twitter
